definition: to grasp/to hold/to operate/to manage/to control/to steer/to exercise/to drill (practice)/to play/to speak (a language)
to guard/to defend/to keep watch/to abide by the law/to observe (rules or ritual)/nearby/adjoining

sentences.english: He says he is confident about his own integrity, and hopes the judicial system will quickly investigate the matter.
sentences.chinese: 他也强调对自己的操守有信心，希望司法尽快侦办。

sentences.english: In clinical practice, confidentiality is always the ethical criterion and conduct for clinicians.
sentences.chinese: 在临床医学中，保密一直是医师们尊奉的圭臬和操守。

sentences.english: Most doctors and therapists will not charge an unreasonable rate both for ethical and practical reasons.
sentences.chinese: 大多数的医生有职业操守，合理收费，不会欺诈病人。

sentences.english: You must guard your reputation &personal integrity。 ..  Temptations are very likely to appear.
sentences.chinese: 你必须捍卫自己的荣誉和操守，你可能面对很多诱惑。

sentences.english: There are no easy solutions to the problem of ensuring police integrity.
sentences.chinese: 在保证警察道德操守这个问题上没有简单的途径。

sentences.english: Many police departments have only modest expectations for the ethical conduct of their officers.
sentences.chinese: 许多警察部门对其警务人员的道德操守只有一般要求。

sentences.english: I stick to my professional virtues, and will never be allured by beautiful women.
sentences.chinese: 我坚持自己的职业操守，绝不会为美色所诱惑。

sentences.english: The meeting of the tourist industry, the research on tourist guides' code of ethics , all these are pure bullshit.
sentences.chinese: 香港旅游业开甚么会，甚么研究导游操守，都是屁话。

sentences.english: The results confirmed the integrity acts as a second-order factor with five first-order dimensions.
sentences.chinese: 结果证明操守是由五个一阶因素组成的二阶因素。

sentences.english: IESG will also ensure compliance by our staff with the strictest standards of security and confidentiality.
sentences.chinese: 亦会确保雇员遵从在个人资料保安及保密方面的操守。

definition: one's character/fret (on fingerboard of lute or guitar)
innate sense of right and wrong/conscience/bosom friend
to be strict with oneself (idiom)/to demand a lot of oneself
